intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius maculato-ornatum, commonly known as the spotted hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it is often found in meadows and grassy areas. This plant is known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a common weed in many regions.
